universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class MonthView.Day

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.MonthView.Day
  • Enclosing class:
    MonthView

    protected static final class MonthView.Day
extends Object
    Represents a single day to be drawn for via MonthView.onDrawDayNumber(Canvas, Day, Paint).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Day() 

    • Method Summary

      Returns a boolean flag indicating whether this day is current or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Day

        protected Day()

    • Method Detail

      • getNumber

        protected int getNumber()
        Returns the number of this day.
        Returns:
        This day's number (as month day from the range [1, 31]).

      • isCurrent

        protected boolean isCurrent()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether this day is current or not.
        Returns:
        True if number of this day is same as current calendar day of month, false otherwise.

      • isPressed

        protected boolean isPressed()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether this day is pressed or not.
        Returns:
        True if area within MonthView for this day is at this time pressed by a user, false otherwise.

      • isSelected

        protected boolean isSelected()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether this day is selected or not.
        Returns:
        True if number of this day has been selected (either programmatically via MonthView.setSelection(int) or by a user via touch), false otherwise.

      • getBounds

        @NonNull
protected RectF getBounds()
        Returns the bounds of this day's number that will be used to properly position its text representation on a Canvas when drawing this day via MonthView.onDrawDayNumber(Canvas, Day, Paint) method. These bounds can be used to draw graphics related to this day like event indicators or a custom day selector.

        Note, that the Rect.top and Rect.bottom will be the exact positions where the text will be drawn, but Rect.left and Rect.right positions will be 'relative'/general for the text representation of number '31'.

        Returns:
        Number text bounds.
